attributes.action: Ban alcohol displays at checkouts and entrances in all supermarkets
attributes.additional_details: We think that alcohol is everywhere in shops—from the moment you walk in to the till. For those trying to stop drinking, this can be overwhelming. Recovery is hard enough without temptation around every corner. Reducing alcohol visibility could offer real daily support and could help protect underage and vulnerable people from constant exposure. We know first-hand how powerful this support can be.
attributes.background: We want legislation that requires supermarkets to sell alcohol only in one designated area, away from entrances, aisle ends, and checkouts. This could support people in recovery, reduce triggers for addiction, and limit exposure to children and vulnerable individuals.
